channel.title: Java | VB
channel.description:
Well, this friend of mine Josh was explaining to me how 'Java' is a useless language and fails every possible way. He thinks that Visual Basics can practically do whatever Java does. So, I am going to ask this fine community what they think. Also, he said Java has horrid conventions compared to Visual Basics. I beg to differ.
Death says: Java doesnt even have a pre-defined compiler/editer, untill someone created eclipse. and yet, eclipse STILL FAILS Patrick says: public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello World!"); } } Patrick says: Rofl Patrick says: java Patrick says: has a predefined Patrick says: compilter Patrick says: hense JAVAC Patrick says: @echo off javac *.java pause Patrick says: Wow, how difficult man. Patrick says: Fucking just blew my brains out ofc Death says: BUtton_Click txtLogs.text = "Hello World" / lbllogs.text = "Hello World" / msgbox("Hello World")
* I was showing him how Java conventions look compare to how his conventions look. Also, he tried to tell me Java does not come with a pre-defined compiler , wow. So, yes apparently after I told him I was going to post this on a forum he said...
Death says: you're such a loser, must not have a life. Seeing as you're going to post this on a forum? First of all i said, IN MY OPINION.

item.title: Java | VB
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

if you are talking about vb.net, the garbage collector is bloated. which is probably what delays the applications performance so much

ownagesbot, i assume you were running vb.net? if so, then .net’s jit compiler is shit. java’s is much faster. iirc, theres a way to disable the garbage collector so that one simply frees the memory manually. this would improve its speed vastly, but would still be at no comparison to java

Read full topic

item.title: Java | VB
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

There are multiple Java compilers.
I once back to backed java and VB, granted my back to backing mechanisms probably can’t be called reliable, but the fact that my java application that did the same job (I even tried to write it in an identical fashion) took something like 500 times less … (It did a few thousand loops, trying to find ‘patterns’)

Read full topic

item.title: Java | VB
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Anyone that stupid you should have just blocked and not bothered with. Java has a compiler and works the same on all platform, plus it uses a syntax similar to C++. VB has a proprietary compiler that works on one platform, and uses a syntax all to it’s own that doesn’t make any sense.

Read full topic

Also, he said Java has horrid conventions compared to Visual Basics. I beg to differ.
